**"We, Our, Us or the Company"** means HL Assurance Pte. Ltd.

**"You or Your"** means the Insured Person or Persons described as such in the Policy Schedule.

### POLICY COVERAGE

#### Section 1. Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement
If You have suffered an Injury, which within twelve (12) months of its happening is the sole cause of Your Death or Permanent Disablement, We will pay You the relevant percentage as set out in the Scale of Compensation, up to the Benefit Limit as specified in the Policy Schedule.
questions: How does the policy define the time frame within which death or permanent disablement must occur following an injury for a claim under Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement to be valid, and what documentation might be required to prove the injury was the sole cause?
In the event of an injury leading to permanent disablement, how is the compensation amount determined according to the Scale of Compensation and Benefit Limit specified in the Policy Schedule?
What conditions must be met for the Company to consider an injury as the sole cause of death or permanent disablement within the 12-month period under Section 1?
How does the policy handle cases where death or permanent disablement occurs after the 12-month period following the injury, and what implications does this have for claim eligibility?
If multiple injuries are sustained, how does the policy determine whether the injury claimed under Section 1 is the sole cause of death or permanent disablement for compensation purposes?
What is the role of the Policy Schedule in defining the Benefit Limit and how does it interact with the Scale of Compensation for claims under Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement?
How does the policy address claims where the injury results in partial permanent disablement, and how is the percentage of compensation calculated in such cases?
In cases where the insured person suffers an injury but dies from an unrelated cause within 12 months, how does the policy treat claims under Section 1?
What are the implications for claimants if the injury leading to death or permanent disablement is complicated by pre-existing conditions, considering the policy’s definition of sole cause?
How does the policy define 'Injury' in the context of Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement, and what exclusions might affect the interpretation of this term?
What documentation and proof are typically required to establish that the injury was the sole cause of death or permanent disablement within the 12-month period?
How does the policy handle claims if the insured person recovers partially but later suffers permanent disablement from the same injury within the 12 months?
In the event of permanent disablement, how does the policy differentiate between temporary and permanent conditions for the purpose of compensation?
What happens if the insured person dies exactly at the 12-month mark after the injury—does the policy consider this within the coverage period for Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement?
How does the policy’s definition of 'You or Your' as the insured person(s) affect claims when multiple persons are covered under the same policy schedule for Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement?

Are there any general or section-specific exclusions that could override or limit the payment under Section 1 for Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement, and how are these communicated to the insured?
How does the policy address the scenario where the injury occurs during a covered trip but death or permanent disablement happens after the trip has ended, within the 12-month period?
What is the process for determining the percentage of compensation payable under the Scale of Compensation, and who has the authority to make this determination?
How does the policy ensure that the Benefit Limit specified in the Policy Schedule is not exceeded when multiple claims or injuries are involved under Section 1?
In cases where the insured person is a minor or elderly, does the policy specify any age-related conditions or limits for claims under Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement?
